caption:
This photograph captures a dense and lush arrangement of tropical vegetation, predominantly featuring a variety of ferns and other leafy plants. The scene is vibrant with different shades of green, punctuated with shades of brown and the striking appearance of a single red leaf towards the center-left of the frame. The ferns show an array of patterns and textures, from the finely divided leaves to the more rigid, spine-like structures.

In the foreground, a particularly eye-catching plant with long, thin, needle-like green leaves spreads out in all directions, resembling a firework display. This plant appears softer and more delicate in comparison to the darker, tougher-looking ferns that dominate much of the image. The leaves of this plant are bright and lively, contributing a sense of dynamism to the composition.

The background is dense with overlapping leaves and plants, creating a deep, rich tapestry of flora. This intricate layering gives an impression of the wilderness and the biodiversity of a tropical or subtropical forest. The dampness and the natural disorder of the growth suggest a moist climate, ideal for the thriving of ferns.

Overall, the photograph is a close-up portrayal of a natural setting, focusing on the beauty and complexity of forest undergrowth without any human presence or artificial elements, offering a glimpse into a tranquil, purely natural environment.
title: Equisetum growing in a 50-year-old age class private timberland in Kitsap County, Washington.  Near Seattle
